headline: Mercosur trade deal will have uneven effects on EU countries
subhead: From Dutch ultra-productivism to Greek micro-farms, European agriculture – already weakened by climate change, animal epidemics and competition – has struggled to present a united front in response to the free trade agreement.

headline: Kais Saied and Tunisia's downfall
Trump taps former British prime minister Tony Blair, US military head for Gaza
US judge restricts federal agents over Minnesota protests after Trump says no reason for Insurrection Act
subhead: Amid the escalating row between Trump and Minnesota leaders this week, the president had threatened to invoke the Insurrection Act, allowing him to deploy the military to police the protests. 'If I needed it, I would use it. I don't think there is any reason right now to use it,' Trump told reporters at the White House on Friday.

headline: 'That 'Stranger Things' brings Prince or David Bowie back to life is both wonderful and dreadful'
subhead: In the final episode of the hit Netflix series, 15- to 25-year-olds discovered 'Purple Rain' and 'Heroes,' whose streams have soared across music platforms. Unfortunately, the younger generation has limited itself to these snippets, showing little interest in the artists or their discographies, writes Michel Guerrin, editor-in-chief of Le Monde, in his column.

headline: Is it ever a good idea to... wear white in winter?
subhead: In fashion, as in life, it is important to know the lines you should not cross. Or else, to do so deliberately.

headline: Brexit's unpopularity reignites debate in UK over EU ties
subhead: In June 2025, 56% of Britons said their country should not have left the EU. Faced with this growing skepticism and the unraveling Western alliance, Prime Minister Keir Starmer, who had stayed cautious on the issue, has shifted tactics, recognizing the need to find allies beyond the US.

headline: Venezuela interim leader sacks industry minister, a Maduro ally
Trump threatens tariffs as US lawmakers back Denmark, Greenland
Dembélé brings PSG back to the top of Ligue 1
French authorities seize nearly €1 billion from Russian oligarchs since the start of war in Ukraine
French health agency warns of social media risks to teenagers
Trump says 'thank you' to Iran for not hanging protesters
Behind Iran's brutal crackdown, rulers play for survival
US air authority warns of 'military activities' over Mexico, Central America
Yann Le Cun: 'Why I'm leaving Meta to launch my own AI start-up'
How a uranium supply coveted by Russia ended up in limbo in Niger
How Gianni Infantino's pay quadrupled in 10 years as head of FIFA
Venezuela two weeks after Maduro's abduction: 'I was scared, then I cried with joy. Now, I'm scared again'
Golshifteh Farahani, Iranian actress: 'Resisting horror, dictatorships and invaders is in our blood'
subhead: In an op-ed for Le Monde, the exiled actress, an icon of Iranian women's fight for freedom, responds for the first time to the ongoing massacres in Iran.

headline: Benedictine nuns of Montmartre spent 40 years 'under duress,' report finds
subhead: An independent investigation, commissioned by the congregation of the iconic Paris neighborhood, reported that former prioress general Mother Marie-Agnès ruled through an atmosphere of 'terror and suspicion' up to her death in 2016. The control of food and body weight of the congregation's members was central to the superior's domination.

headline: Germany questions future of the European project
subhead: Berlin has expressed doubt about the European Union's ability to withstand the rise of nationalist parties and the pressure from the Trump administration. The unprecedented German skepticism has raised fears of lasting weakening, or even the gradual marginalization, of Europe as it exists today.

headline: Regulating social media is key to protecting young people's health
'Corporate America is crushing the planet with its profits'
Trump's disastrous undermining of the Federal Reserve
